meta.name: description
meta.content: Eventbrite - Dr. Anthony Santella, Associate Professor of Public Health, Hofstra University presents What Every Elementary/Middle Student Needs to Know about the Coronavirus - Saturday, March 21, 2020 | Saturday, May 2, 2020 - Find event and ticket information.

meta.content: What Every Elementary/Middle Student Needs to Know about the Coronavirus

meta.name: twitter:description
meta.content: CLICK "SELECT A DATE" BUTTON TO SEE ALL AVAILABLE DATES. ALL SESSIONS ARE EASTERN TIME ZONE. PLEASE PLAN ACCORDINGLY. YOU WILL RECEIVE THE LOGIN LINK VIA EMAIL 1 DAY AND AGAIN 2 HOURS BEFORE THE SESSION. CHECK YOUR SPAM FOLDER IF YOU DONT SEE IT. ASantella@gmail.com if you need to reach me! This webinar is designed for elementary and middle school children. While children are our primary audience, we welcome parents/guardians, teachers, counselors, school administrators, health professions who work with youth and anyone who is interested in getting information on the novel coronavirus or COVID-19. The webinar will use medically accurate and age appropriate content for children in grades K-8. The content will focus on basic facts related to the science and public health along with frequently asked questions about how the coronavirus impacts things that matter to children like their friends, pets, vacations, etc. Presenter is Dr. Anthony Santella, Associate Professor of Public Health, at Hofstra University. You can read more about him here: https://www.hofstra.edu/faculty/fac_profiles.cfm?id=4773 http://www.anthonyjsantella.com/

YOU WILL RECEIVE THE LOGIN LINK VIA EMAIL 1 DAY AND AGAIN 2 HOURS BEFORE THE SESSION. CHECK YOUR SPAM FOLDER IF YOU DONT SEE IT.
ASantella@gmail.com if you need to reach me!

This webinar is designed for elementary and middle school children. While children are our primary audience, we welcome parents/guardians, teachers, counselors, school administrators, health professions who work with youth and anyone who is interested in getting information on the novel coronavirus or COVID-19. The webinar will use medically accurate and age appropriate content for children in grades K-8. The content will focus on basic facts related to the science and public health along with frequently asked questions about how the coronavirus impacts things that matter to children like their friends, pets, vacations, etc.
Presenter is Dr. Anthony Santella, Associate Professor of Public Health, at Hofstra University. You can read more about him here:
